data.title: Mac OS X :: 0.10.9 :: No Intellisense for PowerShell variables
data.body: It seems that variables are not showing up in Intellisense, although the editor itself is highlighting the other variable references (_first screenshot_). Hence, I can't tab-complete to save myself time and effort. Am I the only one seeing this @daviwil? I know the PowerShell engine / Editor Services isn't available on Mac OS X, but I figured it could "fake it" like with Bash variables (_second screenshot_) Cheers, Trevor Sullivan Microsoft MVP: PowerShell

data.title: Adds custom terminal launch settings
data.body:
This allows windows and linux users to specify which terminal they would like to launch when using the browser context menu -> "Open in Command Prompt". 
Falls back to the default terminal if no settings specified.

New setting examples: 

``` js
// Place your settings in this file to overwrite default and user settings.
"terminal.external": {
    "windowsExec": "cmd", // default
    "linuxExec": "x-terminal-emulator" // default for debian, otherwise "gnome-terminal" for gnome desktops
}
```

Ensures any spawn error is sent to the errors.onUnexpectedError event.

relates to #597

data.title: Allow editing shortcuts that include mouse buttons
data.body: There's a particularly annoying limitation in Ubuntu where the "alt+LMB" combination is already reserved by the system which impedes the placing of multiple cursors in the program with said shortcut. Might you consider changing the shortcut or allowing users to change it themselves?

data.title: Save the splitted screens widths

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
It would be better if the widths of the splitted screens of the editor could be saved and restored.

It is always set to 50% when unsplitted / resplitted. I think a saved value would be more practical.

data.title: Unable to target CoreCLR from Visual Studio Code
data.body:
Hellp everyone,

I created a totally empty project and specified only CoreCLR as targetted framework; i.e., in `project.json` I have:

```
"frameworks": {
    "dnxcore50": {}
}
```

On my PC, the dnvm confirugration is the following:

```
Active Version           Runtime Architecture OperatingSystem Alias
------ -------           ------- ------------ --------------- -----
       1.0.0-rc1-update1 clr     x64          win
       1.0.0-rc1-update1 clr     x86          win
  *    1.0.0-rc1-update1 coreclr x64          win             default
       1.0.0-rc1-update1 coreclr x86          win
```

Still, when I run the application I receive:

```
System.InvalidOperationException: The current runtime target framework is not compatible with 'SomeProject'.
Current runtime target framework: 'DNX,Version=v4.5.1 (dnx451)'
 Version:      1.0.0-rc1-16231
 Type:         Clr
 Architecture: x86
 OS Name:      Windows
 OS Version:   10.0
 Runtime Id:   win10-x86

Please make sure the runtime matches a framework specified in project.json
```

Visual Studio Code is still "thinking" that it should run x86 CLR DNX and not the x64 CoreCLR one.

I'm not sure if this is a Visual Studio Code issue, or ASP.Net Core tooling issue; and appreciate any hint and help.

data.title: [folding] Expand action should restore cursor position inside folded region iff cursor didn't change since fold action
data.body:
Confusing, but let me elaborate. Before #3400, I could run `Fold` `Fold` `Fold` actions in a deeply nested folding region and then `Expand` `Expand` `Expand` and my cursor would return back to the original position.

Although #3400 is the good fix, it did remove that functionality unfortunately.

Maybe there is a way for the actions to cooperate between themselves and have the expand action restore the cursor position iff it hasn't changed since the fold action.

data.title: Breakpoint actions should only be enabled when there are breakpoints to reapply/deactivate
data.body: Both the `Reapply all breakpoints` and the `Deactivate breakpoints` actions should only be enabled iff there are breakpoints

data.title: Typo in code folding comment "wheter" should "whether".
data.body:
// Controls wheter the editor has code folding enabled
    "editor.folding": true,

Should be "whether".
Given we're going to highlight this feature in February and let users know they can disable it, we should fix this visible comment.

data.title: Version in vscode.d.ts docstring is confusing
data.body:
The version in the doc string header of [vscode.d.ts](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/vscode.d.ts#L7) is confusing as even on the 0.10.8 release it still claims to be version 0.10.1. 

It makes it difficult to tell what version of the api you are based off as for some reason the yo code generator did not setup my vscode.d.ts correctly leading to some of the [newer options](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/extensionAPI/vscode-api#431) not existing in the file. 

I had to manually run npm install to get the correct version (which worked) but the version number at the top was still confusing. 

I realise this is probably two issues, and can split it if you wish.

data.title: underscore is indistinguishable in links
data.body: when a link, src or url... contains an underscore character ( _ ) , you can't distinguish it from a misplaced space character because of the default underline below the links.

Coincidentally, whenever this happens I also see the error stream spitting information in my console. Attaching my current log files for reference.

data.title: Reinstalling an extension that is on the 'delete' list silently fails and is very confusing.
data.body:
- uninstalled vscode-eslint, this results in adding it to the about to delete on next restart
- reinstall vscode-eslint

There is no feedback that this didn't have any effect. 
I suggest that we check whether an extension that is about to be installed is on the 'delete' list. If it is then we inform the user with the suggestion to restart Code.

data.title: Cannot modify `editor.insertSpaces` setting anymore
data.body:
Have a file test.txt:

```
function a() {
    var a = {
        x: 3
    };
}
```

Use the following settings in the user settings and make sure there are no workspace settings:

```
{
    "editor.renderWhitespace": true
    , "files.autoSave": "afterDelay"
    , "editor.tabSize": 4
    , "editor.insertSpaces": false
    , "files.trimTrailingWhitespace": false 
}
```

Open the file and the user settings side-by-side:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5047891/13333173/fbf40c4e-dc05-11e5-85d2-1633e97e4e55.png)

Go in test.txt and press a Tab. It is ok, it inserts a tab character:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5047891/13333197/15caf4ac-dc06-11e5-9073-4b298e65fbff.png)

Go to the settings and change `"editor.insertSpaces": true`.

Go back to the file and press another Tab. Observe, it still inserts tabs.

This used to work.

**The editor status contribution should change editor options only if there was a manual user interaction with the tab status for the file**
